info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
At 335 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Chillicothe, moving east at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible.
Locations impacted include... Hocking Hills State Park, Starr, Ilesboro, Mooresville, Haydenville, Laurelville, South Bloomingville, Massieville, Murray City, Union Furnace, Adelphi, Hide-A-Way Hills, Oreville, Carbon Hill, Buena Vista in Hocking County, Gibisonville, Hideaway Hills, Lake Logan State Park, Summithill, and Londonderry.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building.
Motorists should slow down and use extra caution.
When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens.
Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central and south central Ohio.
To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HOCKING AND SOUTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT
